result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan M Drapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Susan M Drapp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
15A 040141
Did not assess restitution when money was applied the first time. Had money moved back into bond and re-applied it to the case with restitution included in the assessments.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by: Cencreaha B. Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for zero days time served. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Continue her current treatment.          
     *   No violent contact or negative interaction with Cencreaha B.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   No dangerous weapons
     *   Provide a DNA sample and pay all associated costs.
     *   Restitution is set at $120.00.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Defendant Susan M Drapp in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Defendant Susan M Drapp in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Susan M Drapp in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cencreaha B. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Susan M Drapp in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.45.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06-26-2015 at 01:30pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/24/15
